intro: Anil galegoides, commonly known as the lesser vetch, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and waste areas. Anil galegoides plays a role in supporting pollinators and improving soil fertility through its nitrogen-fixing capabilities.
